Sequence Information.Peptide Name: PN7 (Plectasin D9Y,M13G,Q14R, plectasin analog, synthetic AMPs, 3S=S, UCSS1a)
Sequence Information.Source: Amino acid substitution, fungal defensin analog, fungi-derived, natural derivatives

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (92.5%) toPlectasinActivity: Active against S. aureus 43300 MRSA or ATCC 25923 or E48 or 546 (MIC 1-16 ug/ml), S. epidermidis ATCC 35984 (MIC 16 ug/ml), S. hyicus 437-2 or NCTC 10350 (MIC 4-8 ug/ml), Streptococcus. suis CVCC 606 (MIC 1 ug/ml), S. agalactiae ATCC 13813 or CAU-FRI-4 (MIC 1-2 ug/ml), (MIC 1-16 ug/ml), (MIC 1-16 ug/ml), (MIC 1-16 ug/ml), (MIC 1-16 ug/ml), Gram- E.coli (MIC > 128 ug/ml), S.enterica ATCC 13076 (MIC > 128 ug/ml), S.enteritidis CVCC 3377 (MIC > 128 ug/ml), S.pullorum CVCC 1789 (MIC > 128 ug/ml), P.aeruginosa (MIC > 128 ug/ml), and C.albicans (MIC > 128 ug/ml).Antimicrobial robustness: activity is pH-insensitive (pH 2-10).Toxicity: not hemo.lytic up to 128 ug/ml.Recombinant production:yeast:Pichia pastoris: expressed and purified in a fermentor.
Literature Information.Author: Hao Y, Teng D, Mao R, Yang N, Wang J. 2023
Literature Information.Title: Site Mutation Improves the Expression and Antimicrobial Properties of Fungal Defense.
